name: Seabound
headline: Carbon capture equipment for ships
description: Seabound builds carbon capture equipment for ships. We're the only way for existing ships to reduce up to 95% of CO2 emissions and meet new global regulations.

founders.name: Alisha Fredriksson, Founder
founders.description: I’m on a mission to tackle the climate crisis by decarbonizing shipping. Before Seabound, I launched a climate program and built global partnerships at Generation, a non-profit founded by McKinsey & Co. I also helped start a maritime electro-fuel startup (Liquid Wind), climate activist group (Green New Deal London), global university (Minerva University) , and jewelry social enterprise (Seema).

founders.name: Roujia Wen, Founder
founders.description: I have a background in math/CS/physics/sciences and R&D experience in materials, fluid dynamics, and particle physics. Before Seabound, I built machine learning products at Amazon’s Alexa AI, and completed a master’s degree in Theoretical Physics at the University of Cambridge.

# Ocean-ready carbon capture 
[How it works](http://seabound.co/</#how>)
# Don't wait for future solutions. 
# Start reducing emissions today with Seabound's retrofittable system. 
### How it Works
Seabound locks CO₂ emissions in solid, easy-to-offload carbonate pebbles.
  1. 1.We Fit
  2. 2.We Capture 
  3. 3.We Offload & Store


We design and install the best fit for each ship.
  * Low CAPEX 
  * Simple and compact design
  * Fast installation


We capture your target rate of CO₂—between 25-95%.
  * Abundant supply of sorbent
  * Fully automated
  * Remotely monitored


We collect and offload carbonate at key ports.
  * Simple logistics
  * Carbonate recycled for reuse
  * CO₂ sequestered or sold for fuel production


![](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/jano46oq/production/27e1d7d0fa568553626cf468a04b3d156a34c1c9-1500x1500.png?auto=format)
123
## Take control of your fleet's carbon output.
### Problem
Shipowners face mounting pressure to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from new global regulations, customers, and shareholders, but have limited viable options. Future fuels are decades away, efficiency solutions insufficient, and slow steaming just pushes off the inevitable.
### Solution
Seabound’s onboard carbon capture system is proven and ready today. Shipping drives 90% of the world's economy. Shipowners who want to capture a competitive edge and lead the industry’s decarbonization now have an ocean-ready option with Seabound.
For information on how Seabound can bring value to your business please contact sales@seabound.co.
### Our Partners

#### Team & Advisors
We are a group of entrepreneurs, scientists, engineers, and industry veterans.
Alisha Fredriksson
Co-Founder & CEO
![Portrait of Alisha Fredriksson](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/jano46oq/production/cb354324f3f6d0111fd38c741a72a696e6bdcf34-3658x3658.jpg?w=600&auto=format)
Alisha co-founded and leads the team at Seabound. Previously, she helped build the leading maritime electro-fuel startup, Liquid Wind, and managed global partnerships and launched a climate program at Generation, a global non-profit founded by McKinsey & Company. Alisha was in the Founding Class at Minerva University, ranked the world’s most innovative university, and studied at the Mahindra United World College of India, where she founded a social enterprise called Seema.

generated_description:
**Seabound** is a pioneering company based in London, founded in 2021 as part of Y Combinator’s Batch W22. Their mission is straightforward yet ambitious: to equip ships with the technology to capture carbon emissions effectively. This is crucial in an era where the shipping industry faces increasing pressure to meet new global emissions regulations. 

### The Problem
Shipping contributes significantly to global CO2 emissions, yet shipowners have been limited in their options for compliance and sustainability. Future fuels are still a long way off, and traditional efficiency measures just aren’t cutting it. 

### The Solution
Enter Seabound's retrofittable carbon capture system, which can help vessels reduce CO2 emissions by up to 95%. Their effective design allows for quick installation at minimal capital expenditure (CAPEX), capturing between 25-95% of emissions by converting CO2 into solid, easy-to-store carbonate pebbles. They also provide a streamlined operation: capturing, offloading, and recycling these pebbles at key ports. Simply put, Seabound offers shipowners a proven technology that addresses a pressing challenge today.

### Team & Partners
Seabound is led by co-founder and CEO Alisha Fredriksson, who brings significant experience from her work with maritime startups and climate initiatives. The team consists of nine individuals, including experts in engineering and research, crucial for innovating their carbon capture technology. Their strategic partnerships with firms like Lowercarbon Capital and Eastern Pacific Shipping bolster their credibility and outreach.

### Why It Matters
The stakes are high; shipping drives 90% of the world’s economy. By adopting Seabound’s technology, shipowners can not only comply with upcoming regulations but also position themselves as leaders in the decarbonization of their industry. 

### The Takeaway
Seabound isn’t just a tech company; it's a response to a crucial need in climate action and oceanic sustainability. They're offering a tangible way for the shipping sector to take charge of its carbon output while rethinking its environmental impact. If you're interested in learning more or looking to get involved, check out their website at [seabound.co](http://seabound.co) or reach out directly via their contact page.

In a world hungry for solutions, Seabound is charting a path for innovation in maritime carbon capture. Let's just say they’re not waiting for the future—they’re building it now.
